task: Find a beginner level Coursera course related to "Internet of Things (IoT)" with a high rating. Provide the course name, instructor's name, and a brief summary of the skills that will be taught.
Find a beginner level Coursera course related to "Internet of Things (IoT)" with a high rating. Provide the course name, instructor's name, and a brief summary of the skills that will be taught.
user_action_and_explanation: click the search icon at the top right of the page to start searching for "Internet of Things (IoT)" courses.
observation: The search bar is now ready for input. You can type "Internet of Things" or "IoT" to search for courses related to IoT. Once you enter the search term, a list of relevant courses will appear, allowing you to evaluate them based on ratings and beginner-friendliness.

task: Find a beginner level Coursera course related to "Internet of Things (IoT)" with a high rating. Provide the course name, instructor's name, and a brief summary of the skills that will be taught.
user_action_and_explanation: type 'Internet of Things' into the search bar with the placeholder 'What do you want to learn?' to find relevant courses.
observation:
The course 'An Introduction to Programming the Internet of Things (IOT)' by the University of California, Irvine is a beginner-level course with a high rating of 4.7 from 20K reviews. It covers skills such as Internet of Things, Computer Programming, Computer Networking, and more.

Another option is 'Introduction to the Internet of Things and Embedded Systems' also by the University of California, Irvine. It has a 4.7 rating from 13K reviews and covers communication, computational thinking, and computer programming among other topics.

task: Find a beginner level Coursera course related to "Internet of Things (IoT)" with a high rating. Provide the course name, instructor's name, and a brief summary of the skills that will be taught.
user_action_and_explanation: click on the course 'An Introduction to Programming the Internet of Things (IOT)' to view more details about the instructor and skills taught, ensuring it fits the beginner requirement and gathers comprehensive information.
observation: The course 'An Introduction to Programming the Internet of Things (IOT) Specialization' is offered by the University of California, Irvine. The instructor's name is Ian Harris. This beginner-level course, rated 4.7 out of 5 from 12,379 reviews, guides you through creating your own IoT device. It covers skills such as Arduino, Python Programming, Internet of Things (IOT), and Raspberry Pi. The course is designed to be completed over 2 months at a pace of 10 hours per week and includes a shareable certificate upon completion.
